comment: One of the most famous "won" positions in the history of chess. Dr Tarrasch wrote "the White Knight on d4 stands badly, and this must White's undoing". It is rather sad to think that a world champion and such a world champion - should get into such a hopeless position by move 10 with the White pieces
reasoning: The comment offers a critical assessment of a seemingly passive position, suggesting a missed opportunity for improvement.
